Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Demotic contract
Description: This fragment of a roll of papyrus carries on the front an act of payment relating to the purchase of a house. One can easily distinguish three parts: at the top the original text composed by the lawyer and below the copies made by the witnesses. The beginning of the papyrus, located at the right of our  fragment, has been discovered at the British Museum who gave it to Brussels Museum in 1968. The end of the document, which was written on the left and contained the name of the lawyer, and a list of witnesses on the reverse has not been found.  All the texts are written in Demotic script.
